intro: Clidemia sandwithii, commonly known as the Hawaiian mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forests and streamside areas. Its leaves are usually opposite, ovate, and have a soft, hairy texture. Clidemia sandwithii plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing nectar for native pollinators.
